citation.article-title: Vulcanisaeta distributa gen. nov., sp. nov., and Vulcanisaeta souniana sp. nov., novel hyperthermophilic, rod-shaped crenarchaeotes isolated from hot springs in Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Vulcanisaeta souniana sp. nov.
Vulcanisaeta souniana (so.un.i.a´na. N.L. adj. souniana of Hojo Soun, a historical feudal lord after whom Sounzan, the place of isolation, was named)
Grows anaerobically and tolerates low levels of oxygen (1%) when sodium thiosulfate is supplemented as an electron acceptor.
Growth occurs from 65 to 89 °C and between pH 3.5 and 5.0 when buffered with 10 mM trisodium citrate.
Under optimal growth conditions, doubling time is 4.7 h.
Growth occurs at low salinity (≤1.25% NaCl).
Utilizes proteinaceous substances such as yeast extract, peptone, beef extract, Casamino acids and gelatin, as well as maltose, starch and malate as carbon sources.
Requires sulfur or thiosulfate as an electron acceptor.
Archaeal cell extract or a vitamin mixture has little effect on growth.
DNA G+­C content is 44.9-45.4 mol% (44.9 mol% for IC-059T).
The type strain is IC-059T (=JCM 11219T=DSM 14430T), which was isolated from a hot spring in Sounzan, Kanagawa, Japan.
Strain IC-060 is also included in this species.
